result.execSummary:
The defendant Craig S. Micke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Craig S. Micke

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Case called @ 1:47 p.m. Defendant Craig S. Micke in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant wishes to proceed without counsel although an attorney has been appointed through SPD. The defendant waives his right to counsel. The court accepts voluntary waiver of counsel and will allow a recess for the defendant to speak with DA Blader. 

Case recalled @ 1:51 p.m. DA Blader - offer extended to the defendant which he would be accepting.   Defendant advised of right to counsel and expertise.  Voluntary waiver of counsel accepted by Court.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Plea: Ct 1 - NC.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Statement by DE. Court orders: Costs to include the DNA surcharge w/ 60 DTP or PP. Appeal rights given.

Per the Court - companion citation 15TR825 - DRI.

ADDRESS INFO for Craig S. Micke
Current: 142 N Oak St, Hancock, WI 54943 United States  (Effective: 04-21-2015)
Prior: 130 Northwest St, Neshkoro, WI 54960

No operation of any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license. The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case called @ 1:01 p.m. Defendant Craig S. Micke in court, in custody, appears via video with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will be represented by SPD. ADA Anderson requesting $1000 Sig Bond. No objection by Atty Szilagyi. Court orders $1000 Sig Bond.  NGP entered. STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 01:45 pm.

citations.chargeDescr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
